intro: Solanum vulgare, commonly known as the common nightshade, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into berries, which are usually red when ripe. Solanum vulgare contains various alkaloids, some of which are toxic to humans and animals. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
